field.name: DISDEFWBUF
field.description: Disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

field.name: RETTOBASE
field.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: there are preempted active exceptions to execute

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: there are no active exceptions, or the currently-executing exception is the only active exception

field.name: VECTPENDING
field.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

field.name: ISRPENDING
field.description: Interrupt pending flag, excluding NMI and Faults

field.name: ISRPREEMPT
field.description: Indicates whether a pending exception will be serviced on exit from debug halt state

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Will not service

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Will service a pending exception

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no effect

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: removes the pending state from the SysTick exception

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no effect

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: removes the pending state from the PendSV exception

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending

register.name: AIRCR
register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no system reset request

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

field.name: PRIGROUP
field.description: Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Little-endian

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Big-endian

field.name: SLEEPONEXIT
field.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Do not sleep when returning to Thread mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR

field.name: SLEEPDEEP
field.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Sleep

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Deep-sleep

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor

field.name: NONBASETHRDENA
field.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Processor can enter Thread mode only when no exception is active

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Processor can enter Thread mode from any level under the control of an EXC_RETURN value

field.name: USERSETMPEND
field.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Do not trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

field.name: DIV_0_TRP
field.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Do not trap divide by 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Trap divide by 0

field.name: BFHFNMIGN
field.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or -2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Data bus faults caused by load and store instructions cause a lock-up

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Handlers running at priority -1 and -2 ignore data bus faults caused by load and store instructions

field.name: STKALIGN
field.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: 4-byte aligned

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: 8-byte aligned

field.name: PRI_15
field.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

register.name: SHCSR
register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: exception is not active

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: exception is active

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: exception is pending

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: disable the exception

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: enable the exception

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no instruction access violation fault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor attempted an instruction fetch from a location that does not permit execution

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no data access violation fault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor attempted a load or store at a location that does not permit the operation

field.name: MUNSTKERR
field.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no unstacking fault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: unstack for an exception return has caused one or more access violations

field.name: MSTKERR
field.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no stacking fault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: stacking for an exception entry has caused one or more access violations

field.name: MLSPERR
field.description: MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: A MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

field.name: MMARVALID
field.description: MemManage Fault Address Register (MMFAR) valid flag

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: value in MMAR is not a valid fault address

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MMAR holds a valid fault address

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no instruction bus error

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: instruction bus error

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no precise data bus error

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: a data bus error has occurred, and the PC value stacked for the exception return points to the instruction that caused the fault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no imprecise data bus error

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: a data bus error has occurred, but the return address in the stack frame is not related to the instruction that caused the error

field.name: UNSTKERR
field.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no unstacking fault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: unstack for an exception return has caused one or more BusFaults

field.name: STKERR
field.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no stacking fault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: stacking for an exception entry has caused one or more BusFaults

field.name: LSPERR
field.description: Bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: A bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: value in BFAR is not a valid fault address

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: BFAR holds a valid fault address

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no undefined instruction UsageFault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor has attempted to execute an undefined instruction

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no invalid state UsageFault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor has attempted to execute an instruction that makes illegal use of the EPSR

field.name: INVPC
field.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, caused by an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no invalid PC load UsageFault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor has attempted an illegal load of EXC_RETURN to the PC

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no UsageFault caused by attempting to access a coprocessor

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor has attempted to access a coprocessor

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no unaligned access fault, or unaligned access trapping not enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor has made an unaligned memory access

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no divide by zero fault, or divide by zero trapping not enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor has executed an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

field.name: VECTTBL
field.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vector table read during exception processing

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no BusFault on vector table read

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: BusFault on vector table read

field.name: FORCED
field.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handles, either because of priority or because it is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: no forced HardFault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: forced HardFault

field.name: DEBUGEVT
field.description: Reserved for Debug use. When writing to the register you must write 0 to this bit, otherwise behavior is Unpredictable

field.name: HALTED
field.description: Indicates a debug event generated by either a C_HALT or C_STEP request, triggered by a write to the DHCSR or a step request triggered by setting DEMCR.MON_STEP to 1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No active halt request debug event

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Halt request debug event active

field.name: BKPT
field.description: Debug event generated by BKPT instruction execution or a breakpoint match in FPB

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No current breakpoint debug event

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one current breakpoint debug event

field.name: DWTTRAP
field.description: Debug event generated by the DWT

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No current debug events generated by the DWT

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one current debug event generated by the DWT

field.name: VCATCH
field.description: Indicates triggering of a Vector catch

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No Vector catch triggered

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Vector catch triggered

field.name: EXTERNAL
field.description: Debug event generated because of the assertion of EDBGRQ

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No EDBGRQ debug event

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: EDBGRQ debug event

field.name: AUXFAULT
field.description: Latched version of the AUXFAULT inputs

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Access denied. Any attempted access generates a NOCP UsageFault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Privileged access only. An unprivileged access generates a NOCP fault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved. The result of any access is UNPREDICTABLE

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Full access

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Lazy state preservation is not active

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Lazy state preservation is active. floating-point stack frame has been allocated but saving state to it has been deferred

field.name: USER
field.description: Privilege level when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Privilege level was not user when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Privilege level was user when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

field.name: THREAD
field.description: Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Mode was not Thread Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Mode was Thread Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

field.name: HFRDY
field.description: Permission to set the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Priority did not permit setting the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Priority permitted setting the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

field.name: MMRDY
field.description: Permission to set the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: MemManage is disabled or priority did not permit setting the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MemManage is enabled and priority permitted setting the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

field.name: BFRDY
field.description: Permission to set the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: BusFault is disabled or priority did not permit setting the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: BusFault is disabled or priority did not permit setting the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

field.name: MONRDY
field.description: Permission to set the MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: DebugMonitor is disabled or priority did not permit setting MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: DebugMonitor is enabled and priority permits setting MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated

field.name: LSPEN
field.description: Lazy state preservation for floating-point context

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable automatic lazy state preservation for floating-point context

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable automatic lazy state preservation for floating-point context

field.name: ASPEN
field.description: Enables CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction. This results in automatic hardware state preservation and restoration, for floating-point context, on exception entry and exit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame

field.name: RMode
field.description: Default value for FPSCR.RMode (Rounding Mode control field)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Round to Nearest (RN) mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Round towards Plus Infinity (RP) mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Round towards Minus Infinity (RM) mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Round towards Zero (RZ) mode

field.name: FZ
field.description: Default value for FPSCR.FZ (Flush-to-zero mode control bit)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Flush-to-zero mode disabled. Behavior of the floating-point system is fully compliant with the IEEE 754 standard

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Flush-to-zero mode enabled

field.name: DN
field.description: Default value for FPSCR.DN (Default NaN mode control bit)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: NaN operands propagate through to the output of a floating-point operation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Any operation involving one or more NaNs returns the Default NaN

field.name: AHP
field.description: Default value for FPSCR.AHP (Alternative half-precision control bit)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: IEEE half-precision format selected

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Alternative half-precision format selected
